Reviews.Title: “Survived five days but never again”
Reviews.Author: MzMaggie66
Reviews.Content: Ok we lived there for five days but that was a good lesson to pay more next time and get something better We stayed on a top floor Room 211 I felt really sorry for people liviing there as you could hear every step on the floor anybody made on the whole level The stair case is so net narrow it was a pain to carry luggage There is no elevator Very tought to walk those stairs everyday.Our room only had sink double bed, desk, chair, and mini tv No place to put your clothes or hang it Sorry there were 4 hooks on the wall. Bed was comfortable but very small for two people Staff working there was very helpfully and they served good English breakfast every morning Location was very good but next time I rather stay at the best Western across the street. It cost me £60 to get there from the Heatrow airport Forgot to mention that the bathroom was shared Overall if you are not using ear plugs don't even attempt to stay there as it is extremely loud place anybody with walking problems stay away and if this is the best price you can find and want to save some money - you will survive :)

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking”
Reviews.Author: Martyn R
Reviews.Content: Location: Great! Close to local transport, walking distance to some attractions and numerous places for food and many pubs. Security: In a safe area and the front entrance is video fed to the office. However, the front door lock needs replacing so guests do not spend time jiggling and jostling their key to get it to open. Plus, a basement patio door is permanently unlocked. Decor: Extremely dated, to where all public areas and most rooms need repainting and new carpeting. Accessibility: Not a place for anyone with a physical limitation. Entry doors and internal doors are difficult to push or pull, there is no lift, all stairwells are very thin and winding, and both the reception and dining room are downstairs. Cleanliness: Good. Room: Very, very small and insufficient or non-existent closet/draw space. No bedside table, phone, alarm clock or coffee maker. Some rooms had digital TV but others have basic analog (antenna on top), and one metal (patio) seat is available. The bed or beds are extremely uncomfortable, to the point where sleep was a luxury and back pain was guaranteed. The en-suite bathroom is tiny and only soap and a bath-towel are supplied. Staff: Very courteous and friendly. Breakfast: Very limited and you're still hungry afterwards. Additional info: Wifi is available but only in the dining room. There are additional charges for paying by debit/credit card, internet use, luggage storage, and a(cash) deposit required for your room/entry keys, which are not posted/known by guests. Basement/dining area and rooms in that area smell of fried food at all times. Cost: Too much for what you get. Recommend to others: No! Would say to spend another £20-40 an night at another location, where it's modern and a better breakfast. Return: No! Second visit with no improvements and not expected in future.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean place, good for it's price”
Reviews.Author: Maja S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet neighbouclean place, shared bathroom is not a big deal if you chose so, room is clean, it is small, but you're in London go out!. Location is very good- Victoria is 10 minutes walk. It is very good for it's price. If you're staying longer than three days breakfast can become annoying (choosing between English breakfast and cereal five days in a row is exhausting). Very kind staff.

Reviews.Title: “Home atmoshpere”
Reviews.Author: savvikos
Reviews.Content: A chip solution very close to Victoria Station... Uncomfortable beds... Very Friendly and kind stuff.... makes you feel like home...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staffs, but noisy room”
Reviews.Author: monophobia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, room without bathroom. Located very near to Victoria Train Station, a 5 minutes walk. The location was a plus point for us as we need to depart early to airport on our last day. Friendly staffs, especially Michelle, who served the breakfast and housekeeper, thanks to her warmth hospitality, we feel at home. The minus points includes: - heater in our room is not working properly - room's carpet is kind of musty, though room and bathroom (shared) is very clean - water flowing from the sink in the room is very slow. - very noisy, you can practically hear footsteps, talking from the next door. - no elevator Overall, it is only recommended for those who have a really tight budget and wanted a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Value for money”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: Staid in Enrico Hotel for one night after a dinner in town. Chose the hotel for its location and value for money. For what I paid I wasnt expecting a 5 star hotel, and yes the rooms where a bit small and the breakfast limited, but it was more than made up for by the friendly staff, cleanless of the rooms and ensuite and the good basic facilities. Would have liked a slightly thicker curtain as it let a lot of the streetlight into the room and afew of the tiles in the ensuite where cracked but over all it was a great value and will be looking to stay again! As a good value B&B in central London it is ideally priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Value for money, no problems”
Reviews.Author: nzmaximus
Reviews.Content: A nice place for the price you pay, especially because of its location by victoria train and coach stations. Recommended for a solo traveller who needs a simple place to stay for the night, located in central london and on a budget. Staff were friendly, room was small but had wash basin and small tv, breakfast didn't have much choice but was good. Also have facility to store your luggage for the rest of the day when you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Julie M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good located, near the Victoria station. The rooms are small and very basic but clean. We had a room without bathroom so had to use the public showers and toilets. At the begining we were a bit afraid of this but in every moment of our stay they were very clean. Every day the changed the towels. The breakfast was nice, you could chose between English or continental. The breakfast lady was very friendly and kind to the guests. We only had one minor problem, there was no wifi in our room. We had to go downstairs to the public area to connect to internet but after 22:00 it was already closed. I would recommend this hotel to people who want to discover the city and don't spend much time in their hotel. Its clean and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good for tight budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Frederick M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Enrico Hotel in London for 3 nights in a single bedroom, shared bathroom. The bedroom was OK, with a sink,a bed & a tv. The TV wasn't working but I didn't care, I wasnt in London to watch TV. The bedroom wasn't too small for the price. I think there were bedbugs. The bed was VERY soft. The breakfast was good. The bathroom was terrible, there was no COLD or temperate WATER!! You had to to take a shower with 40Â°C-water. Thank god there were several bathrooms. I would recommend it if you spend just a few days. Don't stay here for a week. Anyway ENJOY London! Don't stay in ANY hotel too much,there's so much to see!

Reviews.Title: “Poor but cheap”
Reviews.Author: davidspillett
Reviews.Content: Ok for an overnight stay. Rooms very basic and needs new carpets and decorating throughout. Close to the key tourist areas. Certainly pay for what you get considering the prices of the good hotels in London.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room in the basement - but quite good location”
Reviews.Author: JullyTheTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in Enrico Hotel while in London. I know that London is expensive - but it was definitely too much for that extremely basic place. Our room was in the basement of the building, with very small window overlooking the wall. The bed-linen was worn and the bed hard. The furniture was very-very basic - just two beds, a table and a chair. There were huge gaps in the door. On the bright side, the bed-clothing looked clean and both the bathroom and toiled were clean as well. The facilities are on the second floor. It was more like a private room in a hostel - not a hotel. And they asked a deposit - although our booking was fully paid before arrival. What I really liked was the location. The hotel is close to the Buckingham Palace - maybe 10 minutes walk (or little more) and the Victoria Station. Lets say IÂ´d stay there again - if it was way cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: CBnSB
Reviews.Content: Very basic facilities. Thin mattress on sagging bedsprings. Communal bathroom often on another floor. Good included breakfast and staff were helpful, happy and friendly. Great central location. Internet patchy and only in the dining room.

Reviews.Title: “good for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: shazza225
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here for 1 night in July 2011. We found the staff very friendly and helpful.The breakfast was lovely.The room was ok,very basic but clean.The en-suite bathroom was tiny,and i had problems with the shower,it was burning hot or just a trickle of water. Overall i would stay here again,the location is excellent.Within walking distance to Buckingham palace, Westminster abbey ,Big Ben etc.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is a stretch of the imagination”
Reviews.Author: rollingstone83
Reviews.Content: This would more accurately be described as a B&B. It's made up of two old row houses that have been connected together. The building isn't in great shape. The carpets are dingy, old and dirty. My room was very basic. There was a bed, with an extremely bad mattress, and the frame shook if I moved around on the bed, just a little bit. Wireless was promised as part of the package, but they seem to have a home account that's overwhelmed when too many visitors try to use it at once. Good luck trying to get access in your room. Making phone calls will cost you cash. Bathrooms are clean but you won't get one in your room, you'll share with others. The owners seem like the friendly sort, but like I mentioned with the phone calls, they seem to need to squeeze every bit out to make ends meet. The upside? The location. Just off Victoria station, which has a direct express to Gatwick airport. Loads of theaters around the station (Billy Elliot and Wicked) were playing when I was there. You can walk to places like Big Ben, the Thames, Buckingham Palace, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful - Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: possum253
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first few nights of a 5 week honeymoon in europe. We made the decision to stay in more budget accomodation in the cities (after all you only sleep there right?), and save our pennies for more luxury B&Bs in the country. Our criteria was somewhere in a great location, cheap, clean and friendly and that is certainly what we got. the rooms are small but clean and comfortable, the staff was lovely and it was walking distance from all major London attractions. It also included a very nice continental breakfast. Would definately go back. only negative is trying to find the bathroom in the middle of the night - the building is old so a lot of stairs and corridors and you can get lost, but we found it quite amusing.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel, good enough”
Reviews.Author: Scincus
Reviews.Content: If you search a relatively cheap hotel (the name B&B is better) and your are not a demanding guest, you have a good choice with Enrico. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The room where we stayed (in the basement) was small. There were 3 beds and that filled the room. The bathroom was small too, but clean. The breakfast was simple, but good enough for us. If we visit a city for pleasure, we use a hotel only for sleeping and that is what you can do at Enrico.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot say I enjoyed hotel but good location.”
Reviews.Author: GretaEssex
Reviews.Content: Hotel easy to find and in a nice street, but I was not very happy when I dragged my heavy case up to my little bunkbed-room and found the toilet and loo on the next floor up !! There was nowhere to sit in the room, a very scruffy cair not in right place, so after getting some drink ( no kettle in room !!) I managed to get the tv less stripy and sat on the bottom bunk and read my book. Not ideal. The breakfast was ok and pleny of coffee, but I think I stay in a hostel next time !!

Reviews.Title: “would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: jamesanddenise
Reviews.Content: got to the hotel they were moving beds all around the hotel and was told to come back around 3pm to 4pm i told them we can book in at 2pm, we had a long coach journey so wanted to relax, whoever they did get the room done by 2pm, we was put right up the top of the hotel we was shattered by the time we got to the top, the stairs were shattering, our room wasnt clean dust all over the place, the curtains were just about hanging on the rail, the headboard was covered in dust, they had just fitted toilets in the hallway and they were all loose, the hot tap didnt work in the toilet and there was nothing to dry your hands on, very unhygeinic indeed, the shower , well i wouldnt even put my dog in there it was filthy and mouldy, the breakfast was ok very pleasent staff, the bed was awful i didnt get a wink of sleep as my back was killing me, nowhere to put your clothes as the drawers were filthy, judge for yourself i wouldnt stay here again. it needs a good clean, on the plus side its close to the rail and coach station, apart from that nothing good to report.

Reviews.Title: “Very central B&B”
Reviews.Author: bucgoklo
Reviews.Content: London with uncounted population (the last census was 10 years ago, before borders were opened to 12 more countries in the EU) is always trade-off between time and money. Maybe I stay in a cheap place in zone 6 and pay Â£15 for one day travel card, but get up early for 1.5 hour battle on crowded train is not wise option. So for busy schedule Victoria area is ideal. My plan to be out from 9am to 10pm, just need a bed. Room was on lower ground floor, thats the quaint old English buildings whose basement is actually surrounded by windows open into a courtyard, so enough light and fresh air. Radiator was off on arrival but easily turned on. Not much luggage space and just wall hooks for clothes. Bed was clean with firm metal slat base, carpet old but clean. TV clear picture although channel button not working. Bathroom and toilet small but clean dry. Given towel and small wrapped guest soap. Breakfast room had period features which is nice, 8 tables with 2 places and 5 tables with 4 places, choice of English (1 fried egg, 1 slice bacon, baked beans) or Continental (orange juice, cornflakes), both with toast with butter and jam, and tea or coffee. Staff were cheerful and chatty, On arrival late evening it took a while to get their attention, but helpful showing where everything was. Was quiet even though just across courtyard from kitchen. But will occasionally hear suitcase wheels on pavement. Thats the main drawback around Victoria, even friends inside work places there hear it! If need place to sit around relax all day then maybe not so suitable. But for bed and breakfast, in central location at under Â£40, its absolutely fine.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before staying in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jenoml
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews good & bad about this hotel and decided on a one night stay,in retrospect it was the wrong decision.The room was way too small you could hardly pass each other going to the bathroom.Room was freezing and we are talking about January-not one drawer to put anything in,bed uncomfortable.On the plus side (And there are not a lot of plusses) Breakfast was nice and the staff friendly in the dining room.We are easily pleased and not professional moaners but we will not be visiting this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money considering location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: cw00011
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a double room with a shared bathroom. The room was of the standard you would expect for a budget night (Â£54 total) with a desk, sink, bed and analogue TV - it was a small room but all we needed for our stay, the location is also great. The bathrooms, although not on the same foor were very clean and hygienic and had no issues with waiting to use them. The carpets may be old and floorboards creaky, but it was a safe and clean room, and the staff were very helpful in offering extra pillows and blankets. As a girl I would have appreciated a full length mirror but what can you do! I would definately consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Tuishauhau
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Enrico Hotel for 5 nights and liked it. It was a perfect place to stay for our purpose, close to basically everything you have to see in London, clean and relatively cheap. Especially the staff deserves our thanks, they were very friendly and welcoming. For someone who is a light sleeper Enrico isn't propably the best place to stay. Walls were quite thin and especially the noices from corridor could be heard loud and clear to the room. Also the bed wasn't too good. You could feel the stings of the mattress very clearly. But over all it was a very nice stay and we got good value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BOOK THIS HOTEL!!! STAY AWAY... STAY AWAY..”
Reviews.Author: Msgeocat
Reviews.Content: If you are reading this, wondering whether to book this hotel or not, I would suggest that you do not. Our story: After a 26 hour flight from Australia we landed in London and arrived at the hotel feeling very tired (the London transit strike did not help either) and ready to climb into bed. We arrived at the reception expecting to recieve our key - we had already booked and paid for the hotel (in full). However were told that there was no record of our booking and there were no rooms (with a ensuite bathroom) which we had booked. I advised the person that I had emailed earlier - she had replied to my email asking for my reservation number and I provided it - but then did not reply back. I figured that was enough. However what eventuated was that they had no booking and even though I emailed they had not thought to follow it up!!! Which brought us to that fateful night where we stood wondering where we were going to sleep - really really scary and horrible. Turns out the hotel person (we heard her shouting at the agent) uses hotmail and gmail for hotel booking and surprise surprise hotmail is sometimes faulty (and didnt get our booking)! Insane! I am surprised they dont have their reception area set up in a public telephone box! After much begging we were told to go to another hotel in a complete other location at our own expence. Actually she told us to take the subway and bus,but with a transit strike and our first day in London that was rather unfeasible - so a cab ride later we arrived at the....hotel from hell! (see review on Ventures Hotel) - Anyway maybe Enrico is nice to stay at...but all I can say is if you want to have a stress free holiday just stay away!!!!!!! The whole experience was character building , but at the time it was really really really stressful and awful. There are so many hotels in London so why take the risk with Enrico.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: alex_antony
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly; the room was clean but quite small, but was ok for sleeping after visiting the city. Good location close to Victoria Station. Typically English breakfast, coffee or tea, butter and jam. I will definitely stay again at this hotel, and recommended for visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Enrico Hotel, The Hotel from HELL!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pellzon
Reviews.Content: If you hav ANY alternative options for a stay i London including a big black bin choose it! The room we where offered wher covered with black mole, and the so called three singel beds consisted of a wiggely bunkbed from IKEA and a toy bed made for a midget. For a room less than 8 m2 and a "bathroom" even small for Barbie & Ken they have the nerve to ask 99Â£. The hotel can perhapes act as a standin for the London dungeon, ecept the dungeon is a nicer place. AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOD at ALL cost!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you only need a bed to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Avice
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay near Victoria for one night at a reasonable price. We had an ensuite - a small room with an absolutely tiny bathroom, just a closet. The room was clean however and the area and hotel quiet, so it served our purpose. The breakfast was ok, very basic. Staff was friendly and welcoming. If you really aren't looking for luxuries and won't be spending much time in the room, I guess you could manage a longer stay. If you're a bigger person, it might even be better to not get ensuite, because the bathrooms and toilets in the hall seemed to be normal size and showering in the box in the room was uncomfortable. Note that you need to pay on arrival and they charge 2 % extra if you're paying by card, so on a tight budget, make sure you have the cash to pay for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good staff but bathroom horrible”
Reviews.Author: ACMcKandry
Reviews.Content: The location is really close to Victoria Station- about 5 min walk and upon check in the service was good from the staff who were friendly and helpful, however the hotel/rooms are small (but reflected in the price and to be expected in London) however the bathroom was the worst=- it was literally the size of a cupboard - in fact i thought the door was to a cupboard and it smelt bad and was generally unpleasant. No air con so quite warm at night during summer. Apart from that it was ok and the location made up for the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: greekguy29
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very near Victoria station. We got a very nice welcome from the reception (always nice when you come from a long trip-from another country for me). The room was tiny BUT it was very clean and oh my God we finally found a budget hotel with new clean bathroom! (we had an en-suite double room). Beds were good, sheets clean and room cleaning was on every day. We didn't care a lot about the tiny room because most of the time we weren't there, so the clean thing counted a lot for us. Breakfast was nice and stuff overall were very friendly and I think they weren't pretending. They also kept our stuff for the day when we checked out for 1 pound (you can leave them till 22:00).

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: brittneymontana
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this doesn't pass for a hostel. We barely made it up the stairs with our luggage and were cramped into a closet-sized room. The cable on the television was hanging by a single wire. The only positives: clean sheets, walking distance to tourist spots and Victoria station. But.. you could probably find a nicer hotel nearby within the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Good and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: NicoQuebec
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a trip last summer. Ok it's not a 4 stars, but if you look for a cheap hotel, and with a really good location, that's the place! It's about 10 min of walk from big ben and london eye! We had a shared bathroom, but there's enough bathroom for everybody. Of course the room is tiny, but that's pretty usual in London! Breakfast was great, and the staff where really nice! Especially the woman who served us the breakfast, hello to her if she's reading this!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you don't wanna pay too much.”
Reviews.Author: Piikuliisi
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay if you don't wanna pay too much :) Location was great, just about five minute walk to Victoria station. Room was small but clean and warm. There was some noise from outside but it didn't matter when you were so tired of all day walking :D You just fell to the bed. Breakfast was typical British, bacon, toast etc. Just enough to carry you to lunch time. Toilets and shower were clean and there was enough hot water all the time. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the best you can get at this price”
Reviews.Author: Ioana85
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for budget accommodation, then I definitely recommend Enrico. Yes, the rooms are very small and there isn't an elevator but it's clean, the staff is very friendly and the location is excellent - just a 5 minutes-walk from Victoria Station and about 15 minutes by foot from the Buckingham Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Mallorca996
Reviews.Content: The best asset of this resort is its location, a short stroll to Victoria Station, and from there you can reach any corner in London using the public transport. The hotel is obviously old, and dont expect much from the rooms, but for the price you pay is not that bad. I particularly didn't like the english breakfast they offer. If I ever come back, I would have a proper full english breakfats at any place in the neighbourhood for a small amount of money. Bed and toilette tiny. didnt like the small detail of being charged Â£1 on the last day to keep our suitcase for a couple of hours, as I had spent all my cash by that time they used my credit card to charge it with a Â£3 charge in exchange comission, rather than just ignoring the Â£1 charge!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with good English breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sarahar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Enrico Hotel for 4 nights. We had small double room upstairs with tv. Yes its true - the room are small but we were satisfied. The sink is in the room, but the toilet and shavers are in the corridor. The breakfast is included and it is fantastic. You can choice between English breakfast and Continental. English breakfast is egg, beans, bacon, toast, jam, coffee or tea. Continental I think was cereals, juice, .... And the staff was incredible. I think there is one Bulgarian girl she is the most polite person I have meet. Also the location of the hotel is very good. Round 700 meters from Victoria station... I would recomend this hotel - becouse of very good breakfast and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: iv1967
Reviews.Content: I booked a foom for three. It turned out to be so tiny that beds barely fit in there. The worst thing we learned at 6:30 in the morning, when it turned out that our window looks straight into the kitchen window and we were woken up by loud voices and noise. I foung a much better room for the same price around the corner at Edward House Hotel. Oh, and they tried to charge me for additional nights I did not stay there - I had to dispute the charges.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend booking this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: OlgaMichigan
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my husband and son. The room we got had hardly enough space for the 3 beds. There was no space at all to fit our luggage and we could hardly squeeze between the beds. We were offered to put our suitcases into the storage. But we needed our clothes and there were no draws or shelves to keep our belongings. The room was in the basement with a small window. At 6:30 we were awaken by loud voices and the noise from dishes coming from the kitchen, which window was right across from ours. There was an unpleasant smell there as well probably coming from kitchen disposal. We moved out the same morning, we could not bear to stand for another night there. We explained to the hotel owner/manager that these accommodations are not suitable. Despite of that, they charged us for the second night.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: HalmstadMrX
Reviews.Content: A cozy hotel near the inner city. Friendly staff. Central heating. We didnÂ´t have our own bathroom but to me that didnÂ´t matter since I didnÂ´t have to wait on my turn one single time.

Reviews.Title: “Value-does exactly what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: littleemme
Reviews.Content: We initially booked a four night stay in the Dover hotel, but when we turned up the news was broken to us that the agency we booked with had taken too many reservations for the number of rooms available, so we were moved to the Enrico that was just around the corner on Warwick Way. After our initial anger and disappointment, we were dreading the prospect of spending almost a whole week in a hotel we knew nothing about. However, once we got there we were put at ease by the warm welcome (initially from a voice that was shouting up to us from the lower floor, which was quite entertaining!). We were shown to our room-the same basic one that I'd booked with the Dover, but as a bonus we had the option of an English or continental breakfast, rather than just the continental that we would have recieved from the Dover. The basic room was very clean, warm, with a portable t.v and a private sink which was really handy! The shared bathroom (we had a choice of two showers) did the job despite the tempremental fixing on one of them, but they were always clean and hot. The breakfast was served by pleasent staff, and as much toast that you desired was on offer. However, don't expect an English breakfast with all the trimmings;no sausages with this one I'm afraid!! The location is excellent, with two underground stations (Pimlico and Victoria) within about a three minute walking distance. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends. So over all a jolly nice time!

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Small”
Reviews.Author: kubbingj
Reviews.Content: We booked online and verified by telephone a triple room. Upon arrival found a triple room unavailable. The room were TINY...not just small but TINY. Noisy guests arrived at about 11:30 p.m. and the sound of the partying went on until 4 a.m. - no lifts, no anything... and a very long walk from Victoria Stn. There were other hotels much closer for the same amount of money. Wouldn't recommend staying there unless you're very young and don't care about sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Verry BAD Choice”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_Sarrah
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have found out about this so called Enrico Hotel , which in my own opinion should be a Motel, from the hotel's own site. Of course on the web all photos ware nice and the rooms looked big and tidy...well, guess what? THIS IS TOTALLY FALSE ! Having said that, I think of the two stars they pretend they have NONE is more than enough! Will start with the Reception where, not to be racist, you will be greeted by someone who can hardly speak English and you will have a real problem making your self understood. The Rooms will be a SHOK !!! Its like entering in an ORFANAGE !!! Small rooms with grey dirty walls, spots here and there, just horrible to look at ! The Bathrooms are again something you will experience for the first time in your life, they are so tiny you can't even fit two people in there properly. The Furniture is a plane JOKE, everything just falls apart, what ever you touch just brakes or it was broken before and it is there just for decorative purpose, you will find that even the BEDS are so old and used that you will sink in them like in a hammock. The Breakfast as you would imagine is not a very elaborated one but luckily for us we are not that fussy. You can choose between CONTINENTAL (milk and cereals) and ENGLISH (fried bacon and eggs). Funny thing was that we found out the COOK is also the HOUSEKEEPER.....hilarious !!! Overall a very, very UNIQUE experience but one that we would definitely not REPEAT !!! Jeff & Sarrah

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, avoid, avoid”
Reviews.Author: Boanyoo
Reviews.Content: Booked here via there website & got confirmation. When I got there they 'couldn't find it'. And advised me they were full. So after complaining they offered me a room without ensuite (i booked one with) when I declined, they somehow found a room with ensuite. I tentatively accepted, yet found a room in another hotel. I advised them of such and suddenly my reservation was found & they tried to charge me for cancelling a room they 'misplaced' the booking. Too much hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Safe”
Reviews.Author: redhotbarbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in late October, chose this hotel because we could afford it, and it was close to the Victoria theatre, and we wanted to get there for 7am to queue up for day seats. There were two of us girls, both students. We arrived at 1pm to be told that check in was now at 2pm, (even though it said 1pm on our reservation) but it wasnt such a problem as we were allowed to leave our bags in the dining room. When checking in there is a Â£10 deposit for a key, i wasnt sure about handing in Â£10 but it was retur ned safely to me the next morning The room was small and the walls sloped inwards strangely. Pillows were paper thin, bring ur own, i slept using a coat. But the linen was clean and so was the room. The toilet is tiny but clean. We didnt stay for breakfast because we were out at 7am. But there was someone there in the morning when we checked out. The hotel is very central, we wandered for half an hour and ended up (accidentally) at Buckingham palace. It is about 10 m ins walk from the Victoria stations and shopping centre. Overal... small but clean, not luxurious but better than sleeping in a tent! We paid Â£57 for the night, one twin room. I suppose its pretty good for london, was the cheapest we could find and for the location, it was comfortable. And we felt safe. See the pictures, there was a stain in the carpet... didnt think about what it could have been, but it was behaind the door.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: lizandro
Reviews.Content: Hotel have a good location eventhought it is 6 block from Victoria Station (Underground and Train). -The hotel need upgrading and stairs and very narrow. -Staff was very friendly and helpful. -Wi-Fi for free all over the hotel. -Basic Room Service 24 hours. My bedroom: I booked a double room. It was not big at all but badroom was quite new and look very nice eventhough it had a small size. It is not new that hotel prices in London are too high in comparison to quality and this is just one more case.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and excellent locatoin”
Reviews.Author: Yami_BANGKOK
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and only five minutes away from victoria station, and with 2 supermarkets nearby. The service was nice. The receptionist was very helpful and friendly for providing and checking relevant information for me. Although the hotel is a bit smaller than I expected, but with the reasonable price of B&B in london, i am satisfied. And also the towels, bedsheets and facilities in the room are clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Claire166
Reviews.Content: Booked through 'Last Minute' and paid Â£25 extra for an 'en-suite'. This was basically a tiny shower cubicle with a toilet in it. I have not seen anything so small and impractical since a (particularly disasterous) boating holiday 5 years ago. I had to drag my case down some tiny stairs to check in where I was in turn told I couldn't check in without a passport (I'm from Wigan!), without ID and when they eventually accepted my 'last minute.com' booking reference they said I hadn't paid (I had). After a long time sorting I eventualy dragged my case up 4 flights of stairs as there was no lift. I can't comment on the breakfast- didn't fancy putting anything in my mouth that came from the same hotel that offered me a tv with no remote control or option to turn the volume up/down or change the channel- all the manual buttons on the set had been broken. The location is ok, but the service and facilities would mean I would never go back again, and would definitely advise against anyone else staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but cheap and clean. Great little hotel for economical travelers”
Reviews.Author: illgothere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a pleasant 3-night stay here in June 2007. Our room was on ground level with a bathroom (ensuite, otherwise you're using a clean shared bathroom). I was able to access the hotels wi-fi from the room. Rooms are very small, just big enough for the bed and a small desk, and tiny bathroom. Stairway is also very narrow. Standard english breaksfast was a good way to start the day. It met our expectations and we would recommend staying there for the price, just be aware of what you're getting. If you're just looking for a small, clean, cheap room with easy access to London's attractions, this place is perfect. Location is fantastic, just a few blocks from Victoria Station, easy access to the Gatwick Express and the Tube.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but Small !”
Reviews.Author: kartram
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean but very very small .Got a twin ( bunk bed). Food and service was nice. Room was clean and sheets were clean. No elevators Clean Bathrooms and Toilet Awesome location for tourists Decent Breakfast. I would stay here if I was single ..

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel Walking Distance from Station”
Reviews.Author: OutwardBound505
Reviews.Content: The hotel was about a 15+ minute walk, which can be tedious with lots of baggage. It's in a quiet and, what appeared to be, safe area and there's a local bar on the corner where you can grab some traditional food and beer. The rooms were small and most do not have en suite bathrooms, but a shared bathroom on the hall. It wasn't as much of an inconvenience as I thought it would be and I rarely saw anyone else in the hallway. There also was no A/C, which probably isn't such a big deal in London, but we had an unusually warm few days and would have slept a little better if we had the luxury. The biggest downside was the lack of an elevator and up to 5 flights of stairs to conquer. The staff was friendly enough, but some spoke rough English. There's also a breakfast included, but it's not impressive at all. Your choice is English (over-easy egg and beans) or Continental (cornflakes and OJ). There's a computer with internet in the breakfast room that's available 24 hrs/day for a nominal fee. It was one of the cheapest we could find for the time of year and the location and it's not too bad if you're not spending much time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Meet the expectations”
Reviews.Author: JuanManaka
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at Enrico Hotel. Nice and clean room, good breakfast and pleasant staff. Having in consideration the rates and the hotelÂ´s location, I vividly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “If You're Into Basic”
Reviews.Author: Linfield-FC
Reviews.Content: If you're into 'basic' then this hotel is the place for you! The room I was allocated on the first floor (on the front) was extremely noisey at night, and with a bed as comfortable as concrete, sleep was difficult to say the least. Ok it's close to Victoria Rail, and Victoria Coach Station, and therefore Heathrow and Gatwick Airports, but it's in dire need of freshening up. Arrived in my room to find a bra under the bed (need I say more). Value for money, but not a place I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Shafi
Reviews.Content: Clean but small. Can hear next-door people so clearly. Too high up to climb to my room. Very good location but i think 55 quid for such a twin -room is a bit on the high side. 45 quids should be about okay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Basic Place”
Reviews.Author: dem107
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Enrico Hotel. It was clean and the staff was pleasant. I got the dreaded basement room, but it was not too noisy. They gave me the WEP code for free Internet access which was very useful since my mobile phone didn't work in the basement room. I didn't try the breakfast, but they have a pleasant breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Kept me happy”
Reviews.Author: NotACreativeName
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 6 nights in a double bed room in the middle of a heat wave. The ceiling fan in our room was greatly appreciated and made the room over all very pleasent. Our room was on the second floor and faced the main road. With the window open and the fan on full blast, we were never bothered by the noise. We only had the breakfast once. It's food is about the only positive thing you can say about it. Not worth forcing yourself to be up for and it's not a big deal if you miss it. The bathrooms were satisfactory. Nothing to right home about, but clean enough and I never really had to wait for anything. The stairs are pretty steep and a bit treachourous when walking in wet flip-flops, but that's a minor complaint. It was nice having the sink in the room making trips to the common restrooms less necessary. The room was pretty small. The door wouldn't fully swing open because it ran into the bed. It was a bit frustrating to get at our luggage with so little floor space, but this is in line with the price. There was a TV in our room. It only got broadcast TV, but that was enough to get basic news and a weather report. One nice thing was that they have free wireless internet. The only problem with that was you could only really get signal in their dining room. It was a pain at night when the dining room was closed and we had to sit in the hall outside it to use the Internet, but it didn't bother me that much. Overall, considering how little (relatively) we paid to stay their 6 nights, I was very happy with the hotel. Even providing us with a fan the one day we stayed in for a bit in order to beat the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy, run down, but great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in july 2006. I was furious by the level of noise some nights, the walls are so thin you can hear people moving and banging around you, and my top window was broken, leaving it unable to shut, therefore hearing any loud noise from outside could not be avoided. I fthey try and offer you room 201 or 202 DO NOTACCEPT, i got 201 and it was the basement room right next to both the kitchen and reception area, meaning any work in the kitchen was clearly heard which is infuriating at 5am, and also people coming and going at reception was right outside your door, again anger enducing. Room was small, but clean, telly didnt work properly, the shared bathrooms although average in cleanliness were broken during my stay, out of the 2 available showers,1 was broken the whole time, and the other got a blocked drain on my last night. Breakfast was poor, it says full English, when in fact id call it a falklands island breakfast, as in small and cold, a few beans, one fried egg and one rasher of bacon, toast and thats it. some of the plus points are the staff, they were always helpful and gracious, the majority were asain/japanese and always were polite and eager to please. internet is available 24hrs a day, for 99p for half an hour which is handy to research where you are going that day or things to do etc. Location, biggest plus point of the hotel, wonderfully placed in London, just about a miles walk from buckingham palace, and 5 mins from victoria coach station, 10 mins to victoria train and tube. Overall below average, id stay short term to see if you can put up with the noise and if the hotel suits you, and if so, book for longer.

HotelInfo.Name: Enrico Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 77-79 Warwick Way, London SW1V 1QP, England
